Wastewater testing reveals New Zealand’s biggest-drinking regions https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/wastewater-testing-reveals-new-zeallands-biggest-drinking-regions/A2GDMGE625BKZIK34ZDEPAF33M/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/wastewater-testing-reveals-new-zeallands-biggest-drinking-regions/A2GDMGE625BKZIK34ZDEPAF33M/ Jamie MortonA first-of-its-kind study lifts the lid on Kiwi drinking - with some surprising results. Mon, 18 Mar 2024 16:00:00 +0000 The new study is the first time we've measured alcohol use with wastewater testing nationwide, a technique that has yielded insights about Covid-19 and cocaine use. Photo / 123RF
Far North man gets medal for witnessing nuclear bomb tests, 67 years after the event https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/far-north-man-gets-medal-for-witnessing-nuclear-bomb-tests-67-years-after-the-event/ICAIUGKTYVAIJHLHRDNFYDQUEY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/far-north-man-gets-medal-for-witnessing-nuclear-bomb-tests-67-years-after-the-event/ICAIUGKTYVAIJHLHRDNFYDQUEY/ The Far North's Russell Hockley finally gets his King Charles III Nuclear Medal. Mon, 18 Mar 2024 16:00:00 +0000 Far North man Russell Hockley (centre) finally received his Nuclear Medal recently at Kaitāia RSA, 67 years after witnessing nuclear bomb tests in the Pacific. Also at the presentation were family members (from left) Karen Subritzky, Jacqueline Hiku, Russell Hockley Jr and Cynthia Shailes.
